--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Derek James <djames@g...> wrote:
> On Mon, 20 Sep 2004 06:47:33 -0000, Kenneth Stanley
> <kstanley@c...> wrote:
> > Unfortunately I don't know the best way to sample images. 
However,
> > your project is really cutting edge and I am looking forward to
> > hearing what you accomplish.  What made your decision to first
> > submit to a journal as opposed to a conference?  I think it would
> > probably be a lot of fun to present this kind of exciting work at
a
> > conference where you can see people's reactions.
> 
> Well, we plan on experimenting with this approach using
progressively
> more difficult recognition tasks, so hopefully we'd had something
even
> more impressive to demo at a conference next year.
> 
> But I came across this call for papers:
> 
> http://cienciascomp.cicese.mx/CallxPapersPRL.htm
> 
> And it seemed to fit perfectly with what we're working on.  Plus,
> since we don't have advisors standing over our shoulders, we like to
> have deadlines to keep us motivated, and this seemed like a good
one.
> 

You're right that does seem to fit perfectly.

ken
